form.official-title: To amend section 1115 of title 31, United States Code, to amend the description of how performance goals are achieved, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Performance Enhancement Reform Act.
Section 1115 of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (b)(5) to read as follows:
provide a description of how the performance goals are to be achieved, including—

subparagraph.text: the human capital, training, data and evidence, information technology, and skill sets required to meet the performance goals;

the technology modernization investments, system upgrades, staff technology skills and expertise, stakeholder input and feedback, and other resources and strategies needed and required to meet the performance goals;

an identification of the organizations, program activities, regulations, policies, operational processes, and other activities that contribute to each performance goal, both within and external to the agency;

a description of how the agency is working with other agencies and the organizations identified in subparagraph (D) to measure and achieve its performance goals as well as relevant Federal Government performance goals; and
an identification of the agency officials responsible for the achievement of each performance goal, who shall be known as goal leaders;

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (g) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Chief Performance Improvement OfficeOfficer of each agency (or the functional equivalent) shall collaborate with the Chief Human Capital Officer (or the functional equivalent), the Chief Information Officer (or the functional equivalent), the Chief Data Officer (or the functional equivalent), and the Chief Financial Officer (or the functional equivalent) of that agency to prepare that portion of the annual performance plan described under subsection (b)(5) for that agency.

section.text: The budgetary effects of this Act, for the purpose of complying with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go-Act of 2010, shall be determined by reference to the latest statement titled Budgetary Effects of PAYGO Legislation for this Act, submitted for printing in the Congressional Record by the Chairman of the HouseSenate Budget Committee, provided that such statement has been submitted prior to the vote on passage.
